oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Snow wetness retrieval inversion modeling for C-band and X-band multi-polarization sar data
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, G
VENKATARAMAN, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper is concerning the estimation of snow wetness from multi-polarization SAR data. In this paper, microwave interaction with snow covered terrain and different scattering mechanism from snowpack and their backscattering model for developing inversion algorithm with wet snow conditions are described in order to estimate snow wetness. SAR data processing and field measurement of snow parameters are also discussed. In this study, snow wetness has been measured with a dielectric moisture meter with synchronous satellite passes over the part of snow covered Indian Himalayan region (e.g. Dhundi observatory in Himachal Pradesh, India).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2010 IEEE INTERNATIONAL GEOSCIENCE AND REMOTE SENSING SYMPOSIUM,4664-4667
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium,Honolulu, HI,JUN 25-30, 2010
